sentences.sContent: An adjective must agree with  its noun in mumber and case.
sentences.sContent_eng: An adjective must agree with its noun in mumber and case.
sentences.sCn: 形容词在数和格方面必须符合其所修饰的名词。

sentences.sContent: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.sContent_eng: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.sCn: 在“那只黑猫”中，形容词“黑的”修饰名词“猫”。

sentences.sContent: On the spines of books shelved in certain libraries and bookstores you will see OATES but this is a descriptive term, this is not a noun.
sentences.sContent_eng: On the spines of books shelved in certain libraries and bookstores you will see OATES but this is a descriptive term, this is not a noun.
sentences.sCn: 在某些图书馆或书店里某些图书的书脊上，你会看见“欧茨”，但这里的“欧茨”不能作名词解，它是个描述性的词语。

trans.tranOther: a word or group of words that represent a person (such as ‘Michael’, ‘teacher’ or ‘police officer’), a place (such as ‘France’ or ‘school’), a thing or activity (such as ‘coffee’ or ‘football’), or a quality or idea (such as ‘danger’ or ‘happiness’). Nouns can be used as the subject or object of a verb (as in ‘The teacher arrived’ or ‘We like the teacher’) or as the object of a preposition (as in ‘good at football’).
